internal.content: --- title: "Change Risk Training" date: 2022-11-03T10:57:46+01:00 weight: 64 --- ## üöÄ TASK: Define and run Change Risk Training üåè Documentation for the Task: Setting up training for change risk In this section you will set up and run training for this AI algorithm to determine `how likely it is that a proposed change would cause a problem`. ## Define Change Risk Training 1. In the `CP4WAIOPS` "Hamburger" Menu select `Operate`/`AI Model Management` 1. Under `Change Risk`, click on `Set up training` 1. Click `Next` 1. Click `Next` 1. Under `Deployment type` check `On completion` 1. Click `Done` ## Run Change Risk Training 1. Click on the the `Change Risk` card 1. Click on `Train Models` 1. Status should say `In progress` 1. And eventually say `Deployed`

MdxNode.rawBody: --- title: "Change Risk Training" date: 2022-11-03T10:57:46+01:00 weight: 64 --- ## üöÄ TASK: Define and run Change Risk Training üåè Documentation for the Task: Setting up training for change risk In this section you will set up and run training for this AI algorithm to determine `how likely it is that a proposed change would cause a problem`. ## Define Change Risk Training 1. In the `CP4WAIOPS` "Hamburger" Menu select `Operate`/`AI Model Management` 1. Under `Change Risk`, click on `Set up training` 1. Click `Next` 1. Click `Next` 1. Under `Deployment type` check `On completion` 1. Click `Done` ## Run Change Risk Training 1. Click on the the `Change Risk` card 1. Click on `Train Models` 1. Status should say `In progress` 1. And eventually say `Deployed`
